snippet: The temporal mismatch between signing up for Obamacare and paying a penalty for not doing so may be hurting enrollment numbers.
abstract: The Upshot; number of Democratic senators have been pushing Obama administration to offer special extension for enrollment in health insurances plans in order to help people who have not signed up for plans avoid tax penalty; experts have questioned why enrollment period for plans does not synch up with tax filing season, as that could be more beneficial for law's incentives and for consumers.
lead_paragraph: The temporal mismatch between signing up for Obamacare and paying a penalty for not doing so may be hurting enrollment numbers.

headline.print_headline: Open Enrollment Ends; Now the Tax Penalties Start
headline.main: Enrollment Period for Health Insurance Ends; Now the Tax Penalties Start

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
